GSD.description: The MethodClosure class in runtime/MethodClosure.java in Apache Groovy 1.7.0 through 2.4.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.

description_data.value: The MethodClosure class in runtime/MethodClosure.java in Apache Groovy 1.7.0 through 2.4.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.

reference_data.name: [shardingsphere-notifications] 20200623 [GitHub] [shardingsphere] liuqiankun93 opened a new issue #6180: The groovy-2.4.5-indy.jar has High-level security risks

advisories.affected_versions: All versions starting from 1.7.0 before 2-alpha0, all versions starting from 2-alpha0 up to 2.4.3
advisories.description: The `MethodClosure` class in `runtime/MethodClosure.java` in this package allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.
advisories.not_impacted: All versions before 1.7.0, all versions starting from 2-alpha0
advisories.title: Remote execution of untrusted code in class MethodClosure

description_data.value: The MethodClosure class in runtime/MethodClosure.java in Apache Groovy 1.7.0 through 2.4.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.
